string.text:
Bandits are members of the criminal underworld who operate in the Zone.
 
Whether to flee from their past crimes or to make money from selling artefacts and dealing firearms, their actions leave them despised by almost everybody foreign to their ranks.
 
The faction consists of the Zone's many numerous gangs, operating separately of one another, and guided first by opportunity before any form of organised leadership.
 
Ambushing unsuspecting stalkers, blocking routes and "taxing" those who pass, and even entrapping stalkers into debt are just but a few of their many illicit activities in the Zone.
 
Here, criminals and gangsters can do whatever they want with little fear of consequence.

Clear Sky are a scientific faction dedicated to learning about the Zone's inner workings.
 
Despite recent history they are generally considered to be a peaceful faction, preferring to invest their time and resources into research, rather than in playing politics.
 
They view the Zone and its creation as both a gift and a curse - an incredible event with unappreciated potential - and a threat to humanity if not properly kept in balance.
 
It was this latter part of their ideology which led them to near destruction, in chasing a stalker who they believed would greatly upset this balance, they fielded one of the largest forces ever seen in the Zone.
 
With the ensuing battles against the Monolith in their path, and the emission that followed them, the faction was left leaderless and in a state of disrepair.
 
Today however they are led by Cold, who has helped them to rebuild and recover - carrying on the research of their predecessors and keeping the peace in the far southern reaches of the Zone.

Duty is a paramilitary organisation formed by former soldiers.
 
Characterised by their strict discipline and military attributes, their ideology is built upon the protection of humanity from the dangers of the Zone.
 
In view of this, Duty deals with the Zone's internal problems - the destruction of mutants and bandits - which greatly facilitates the daily lives of ordinary stalkers.
 
Despite taking this hardline approach they have been known to cooperate with Ecologists, handing over artefacts in return for knowledge which could assist them in their ideological crusade.
 
Because of their actions they find themselves at constant odds with Freedom, a faction similar in size and strength, but whose attitude toward the Zone is of coexistence and preservation.
 
After a short-lived truce at Yanov Station bloodily collapsed, their bitter rivalry has yet again embroiled them both in another deadly conflict with no clear end in sight.

Ecologists are an institute of government-backed research organisations.
 
There is no ecosystem anywhere else quite like the one found in the Zone, so naturally there is also a great interest expressed in it by the government.
 
It is for this reason that the faction exists - to study the artefacts, anomalies, mutants and other unnatural objects that can be found only here.
 
Thus far they have established two research labs, one in Yantar and the other in Jupiter, from which they conduct most of their secretive experiments.
 
When working out in the field they are often accompanied by an escort, usually hired mercenaries or stalkers, or are otherwise armed themselves.
 
Many stalkers who hunt for artefacts and rare mutant parts sell them to the Ecologists, as they are usually willing to pay much more than anybody else for them.
